creativecoding.tact

Class Tact

  • java.lang.Object
    • creativecoding.tact.Tact
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TactConstants

    public class Tact
extends Object
implements TactConstants

    A Tact sensor implementation for the Procesing environment.

    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    Steffen Fiedler, www.nand.io

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tact

        public Tact(PApplet parent,
            int serialIndex)
        Tact core. Tact tact = new Tact(this, 5);
        Parameters:
        parent - reference to the main sketch instantiation.
        serialIndex - the serial port to listen to. This index corresponds to the order within the processing.Serial.list() array.
        Since:
        0.2

      • Tact

        public Tact(PApplet parent,
            int serialIndex,
            int baudrate)
        Tact core. Tact tact = new Tact(this, 5, 115200);
        Parameters:
        parent - reference to the main sketch instantiation
        serialIndex - the serial port to listen to. This index corresponds to the order within the processing.Serial.list() array.
        baudrate - pulses per second.
        Since:
        0.2

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Called by PApplet on exit to stop sensor communication.

      • startUpdates

        public void startUpdates()
        Starts Tact sensor communication with specific baud rate. By doing so Tact will initiate an ongoing serial thread that constantly requests signal updates for all registered sensors.
        Parameters:
        serialIndex - the serial port to listen to. This index corresponds to the order within the processing.Serial.list() array.
        baudrate - pulses per second.
        Since:
        0.1

      • addSensor

        public TactSensor addSensor(int pin)
        Adds a new Tact sensor.
        Parameters:
        pin - which will be monitored.
        Returns:
        the instantiated sensor.
        Since:
        0.1

      • addSensor

        public TactSensor addSensor(int pin,
                            String mode)
        Adds a new Tact sensor.
        Parameters:
        pin - which will be monitored.
        mode - request type when communicating with the sensor: TactConstants.SPECTRUM, TactConstants.BIAS, TactConstants.BIAS_PEAK, TactConstants.PEAK.
        Returns:
        the instantiated sensor as TactSensor.
        Since:
        0.2

      • addSensor

        public TactSensor addSensor(int pin,
                            int start,
                            int readings)
        Adds a new Tact sensor.
        Parameters:
        pin - which will be monitored.
        start - index where signal reading are taken from.
        readings - total number of measurements taken from the signal spectrum.
        Returns:
        the instantiated sensor as TactSensor.
        Since:
        0.1

      • addSensor

        public TactSensor addSensor(int pin,
                            int start,
                            int readings,
                            String mode)
        Adds a new Tact Sensor.
        Parameters:
        pin - which will be monitored.
        start - index where signal readings are taken from.
        readings - total number of measurements taken from the signal spectrum.
        mode - request type when communicating with the sensor: TactConstants.SPECTRUM, TactConstants.BIAS, TactConstants.BIAS_PEAK, TactConstants.PEAK.
        Returns:
        the instantiated sensor as TactSensor.
        Since:
        0.2

      • addSensor

        public TactSensor addSensor(int pin,
                            int start,
                            int readings,
                            int step)
        Adds a new Tact sensor.
        Parameters:
        pin - which will be monitored.
        start - index where signal readings are taken from.
        readings - total number of measurements taken from the sensor's signal spectrum.
        step - width between measure points.
        Returns:
        sensor instance as TactSensor.
        Since:
        0.1

      • addSensor

        public TactSensor addSensor(int pin,
                            int start,
                            int readings,
                            int step,
                            String mode)
        Parameters:
        pin - which will be monitored.
        start - index where signal readings are taken from.
        readings - total number of measurements taken from the sensors's signal spectrum.
        step - width between measure points.
        mode - request type when communicating with the sensor: TactConstants.SPECTRUM, TactConstants.BIAS, TactConstants.BIAS_PEAK, TactConstants.PEAK.
        Returns:
        sensor instance as TactSensor.
        Since:
        0.2

      • addSensor

        public TactSensor addSensor(int pin,
                            int start,
                            int length,
                            int step,
                            int bufferSize)
        Adds a new Tact sensor.
        Parameters:
        pin - which will be monitored.
        start - index where signal readings are taken from.
        length - total number of measurements taken from the sensor's signal spectrum.
        step - width between measure points.
        bufferSize - number stored TactSpectrum instances that previously have been received.
        Returns:
        sensor instance as TactSensor.
        Since:
        0.1

      • addSensor

        public TactSensor addSensor(int pin,
                            int start,
                            int length,
                            int step,
                            int bufferSize,
                            String mode)
        Adds a new Tact sensor.
        Parameters:
        pin - which will be monitored.
        start - index where signal readings are taken from.
        length - total number of measurements taken from the sensor's signal spectrum.
        step - whith between measure points.
        bufferSize - number of stored TactSpectrum instances that previously have been received.
        mode - request type when communicating with the sensor: TactConstants.SPECTRUM, TactConstants.BIAS, TactConstants.BIAS_PEAK, TactConstants.PEAK.
        Returns:
        sensor instance as TactSensor.
        Since:
        0.2

      • stopUpadtes

        public void stopUpadtes()
        Stops all Tact updates.
        Since:
        0.1

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        If Tacat sensor communication is present. This flag will be enabled by the startUpdates() method and keeps the serial-update thread alive, until stop() is triggered.
        Returns:
        status if Tact is active as boolean flag.
        Since:
        0.1

      • addTactListener

        public void addTactListener(TactListener o)
        Registers a listener that implements TactListener. This listenerer will be informed about processed Tact signals via by Tact dispatched TactEvent instances.
        Parameters:
        o - object to receive TactEvent updates.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        removeTactListener(TactListener)

      • removeTactListener

        public void removeTactListener(TactListener o)
        Unregisters a listener that implements TactListener. This listener previously received by Tact dispatched TactEvent instances about sensor updates.
        Parameters:
        o - object to unregister from TactEvent updates.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        addTactListener(TactListener)

      • isPowerOfTwo

        public static final boolean isPowerOfTwo(int value)
        Checks if value is power of two. This method is needed by a couple of setters that have to perform this kind of test.
        Thanks to birryree, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5082314/power-of-2-formula-help
        Parameters:
        value - value to test.
        Returns:
        true if value is power-of-two; false otherwise.
        Since:
        0.1
